title: Ticket #5701: broken argument passing for history_helper on windows
description:
On windows, the condor_history_helper.exe always returns error 1 which indicates bad argument passing. 

    if (argc != 5)
    {
         ....
         exit(1)
    }

Given the fact that args are NOT passed as an array into windows programs, and that several of these arguments are likely to be complex and contain "", the fact that argc isn't exactly 5 is unsurprising. Further investigation is needed to be sure, but it seems likely that the way arguments are passed will have to be re-designed.
remarks:
2016-Jun-01 16:55:02 by johnkn:
Upon further investigation, the history_helper was also parsing lines from the history file as if they were using new-classad escaping rules, so \ was getting lost.

Both of these bugs were a consequence of making a new binary to be the history_helper instead of just enhancing condor_history so that it could be asked to write classads into a socket.
